results.title: Adelaide's Christmas pageant
results.creator_credit: G Shepherd and South Australian Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: Presents an annual Adelaide folk event - the Christmas pageant - through the eyes of a small boy. The procession winds its way through crowds of people, with no commentary, only the sounds of Adelaide enjoying the occasion. The pageant is sponsored and presented by a department store but without direct advertising.

results.title: Acupuncture: an exploration
results.creator_credit: Franklin Konigsberg, Permagum Productions and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description: Describes current experiments confirming the effectiveness of acupuncture points. Theories are given explaining its success as an analgesic for surgery, also an outline on the history of acupuncture is briefly explained.

results.title: Activity sampling: a training film
results.creator_credit: David Stevens and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the technique by simulating a real-life office situation. It aims at giving students practice in distinguishing between the various activities observed and calculating results from their observations.

results.title: Activity group therapy: as developed at the Jewish Board of Guardians
results.brief_description: Shows the treatment of children’s personality disorders through their participation in group activities guided by a permissive adult. Focuses on three boys with different problems: one is over-aggressive, another is withdrawn and latently schizophrenic and the third is introverted and suffering from anxiety hysteria. Their progress is traced through many scenes of group activities, filmed with a hidden camera.

results.title: Abstract in concrete (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Arvonio and John Arvonio Productions
results.brief_description: An experimental film produced by photographing neon signs in the wet pavements of Times Square New York. This unusual film was painstakingly photographed on rainy nights, under difficult conditions, over a period of five years. The producer has discovered, and recorded, a wealth of visual beauty in the patterns and movements of the constantly changing light reflections.

results.title: Abraham Lincoln: a background study
results.brief_description: The life of Abraham Lincoln, 16th President of the United States. Describes the difficulties of his early life, through his early political career and his terms as president during the American Civil War.

results.title: Above the timberline: the alpine tundra zone
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Hugh O'Connor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Remote and baffling except to the most daring climbers, the high peaks are worlds apart where only the most tenacious of living things endure. Forests give way to stunted vegetation and finally to the hardiest of plants adapted to withstand the rigours of bitter cold, glaring sun and tearing wind. The only animals found here are the wild, tough ones such as the mountain goat, elk and bighorn sheep. In true-life colour this film presents an account of life at this specialised level. Film award: Film Survey, Trieste, Italy.

results.title: About face
results.creator_credit: Chris James and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: This film gallops through over 60 facial transformations, including animated caricatures of Mick Jagger, Oscar Wilde, The Queen, The Duke of Edinburgh, Prince Charles, Pablo Picasso, Idi Amin, Salvador Dali, Adolf Hitler, The Marx Brothers, and David Bowie. Music by Claude Jouvin.

results.title: About conception and contraception
results.creator_credit: Dorothy Courtois and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Animated drawings illustrate how conception occurs and the way that various birth control devices, surgical methods and ‘the pill’ function in effecting contraception. Without spoken commentary this film is designed to be used by professional personnel.

results.title: Abortion: a tale of two cities
results.brief_description: Uses two dramatised case studies to highlight some of the problems faced by different sections of the community, in the provision of abortion. Intended for women’s groups and for people concerned with health education. Cast includes: Judy Snape, Marlene Sidaway, Max Smith, Derry Jordan, Fred Grant. Narrated by Peter Ellis.
